title: Suspicious sign-in from Tor exit node
description: User signed in from an IP address associated with Tor exit nodes, indicating possible anonymized access attempt.
recommendedActions: Verify the sign-in with the user. If unauthorized, reset password immediately and revoke all sessions. Enable MFA if not already enabled.

title: Malware detected on managed device
description: Microsoft Defender detected and quarantined a potentially unwanted application (PUA) on the device. The file was identified as PUA:Win32/Presenoker.
recommendedActions: Review the quarantined item. Scan the device for additional threats. Verify the user's recent download activity.

title: Suspicious inbox rule creation
description: A new inbox rule was created that forwards all emails to an external address. This pattern is commonly seen in business email compromise attacks.
recommendedActions: Review the inbox rules for this user. Remove any suspicious rules. Verify with the user if this was intentional. Check for signs of account compromise.

title: Brute force attack detected
description: Multiple failed sign-in attempts detected from various IP addresses in a short time period, indicating a potential password spray or brute force attack.
recommendedActions: Verify account is secured with strong password. Enable MFA. Review sign-in logs for successful authentications during the attack period.

title: Sensitive file accessed from unusual location
description: User accessed files marked as sensitive from an IP address in a country the user has never signed in from before.
recommendedActions: Verify with the user if they are traveling. Review accessed files for data sensitivity. Consider blocking access from the suspicious location.

title: Device not compliant with security policy
description: The device has not synced with Intune for over 90 days and is running an outdated operating system version that may contain known vulnerabilities.
recommendedActions: Contact the user to reconnect the device. Update the operating system to the latest version. Run a full security scan.

title: Unusual file download activity
description: User downloaded an unusually large number of files in a short period. This could indicate data gathering for exfiltration.
recommendedActions: Verified with user - legitimate activity related to project archival.

title: Outdated antivirus definitions
description: Device has not received antivirus definition updates for over 14 days. This leaves the device vulnerable to new threats.
recommendedActions: Ensure the device has internet connectivity. Force a definition update. If device is offline, contact the user.

title: Suspicious PowerShell execution
description: PowerShell script with encoded commands was executed. Investigation showed it was a legitimate administrative script.
recommendedActions: No action required - confirmed legitimate IT administration activity.

title: Guest user granted elevated permissions
description: External guest user was added to a SharePoint site with full control permissions. This grants significant access to organizational resources.
recommendedActions: Review if full control is necessary. Consider reducing to contribute or read permissions. Set an access review schedule.
